author: Caroline Vakil
description: Rep. Mikie Sherrill (D-N.J.) and former GOP Assemblyman Jack Ciattarelli are polling neck-and-neck in the New Jersey gubernatorial race just days out from the election, according to a new poll.  An Emerson College Polling/PIX11/The Hill survey released on Thursday showed Sherrill barely edging out Ciattarelli in the race to succeed outgoing Gov. Phil Murphy (D-N.J.). Sherrill...
title: Sherrill, Ciattarelli neck-and-neck in New Jersey governor's race: Poll

author: Niall Stanage
description: Progressives are on the march again in the Democratic Party — and the question is whether their momentum can be sustained. The case that the progressive tide will keep rising is built around the tangible excitement sparked by some prominent left-wing candidates, the frustration among many Democratic voters with their party leadership, and the capacity...
title: The Memo: Mamdani raises left’s hopes of a new wave

author: Joseph Choi
description: The tobacco industry's influence on public health policymaking in the U.S. is growing according to the latest report by the anti-smoking organization Action on Smoking & Health (ASH). ASH's Tobacco Industry Interference Index 2025, provided first to The Hill, found that the U.S. scored an 89 out of 100 on the Global Tobacco Industry Interference...
title: Tobacco industry's policy interference on the rise: report

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump met Thursday in South Korea with Chinese President Xi Jinping, a high stakes sit-down expected to focus on trade between the world's two largest economies. "We're going to have a very successful meeting, I have no doubt," Trump said as he greeted Xi. "He's a very tough negotiator." Trump went on to praise...
title: Trump, Xi hold high stakes meeting in South Korea

author: Max Rego
description: Over a dozen Republican House members, in a letter to Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer, expressed concern over the Trump administration’s plan to boost imports of Argentine beef. “We encourage the Administration to ensure that any adjustments to Argentina’s tariff-rate quota or inspection regime be contingent on verified equivalency and reciprocal market...
title: 14 Republican lawmakers say Argentinian beef imports 'undermine American cattle producers' in new letter

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump said on Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department (DOD) to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia.   “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote. “This was accomplished, including a complete update and renovation of existing weapons, during my First Term in office. Because of the...
title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons

author: Brett Samuels
description: Vice President Vance on Wednesday went toe-to-toe with college students at the University of Mississippi in a nod to his friend and the late conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Vance and Erika Kirk addressed thousands of students at an arena on the university’s campus as part of a Turning Point USA tour. Vance fielded questions from...
title: Vance spars with college students at Turning Point USA event

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced that the United States military conducted another strike against an alleged drug-trafficking boat in the Eastern Pacific, killing four “narco-terrorists” on Wednesday.  Hegseth said the vessel was operated by a designated terrorist organization and was transiting along a “known narco-trafficking route.” It is unclear which designated terrorist organization the defense...
title: Hegseth announces new strike on alleged narco-trafficking boat, killing 4

author: Max Rego
description: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry (R) said Wednesday that Louisiana State University (LSU) athletics director Scott Woodward will not be involved in picking the university’s next football coach.  “I can tell you right now, Scott Woodward is not selecting the next coach,” Landry said at a press conference. “Hell, I’ll let Donald Trump select it before...
title: Louisiana governor says LSU athletic director won't choose next football coach
